network

Class DecisionStructure<T extends Message>

  • java.lang.Object
    • network.DecisionStructure<T>

  • public class DecisionStructure<T extends Message>
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the structure necessary to determine where to send messages.
    Author:
    Bitidork

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DecisionStructure()
      Initializes an empty decision structure.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Node<T> getDecision(Node<T> source, Node<T> destination)
      Gets the next node that a message along the given flow should travel.
      java.util.Set<Tuple<Node<T>,Node<T>>> getDecisionOptions()
      Gets the (source,destination) pairs that map to a hop.
      int getReservedCapacity(Tuple<Node<T>,Node<T>> voq)
      Gets the amount of capacity reserved across the supplied VOQ.
      Node<T> pickRandomInput(Node<T> output)
      Picks a random input, weighted based on the reserved capacity through the output, using the thread's local random number generator.
      Node<T> pickRandomInput(Node<T> output, java.util.Random rng)
      Picks a random input, weighted based on the reserved capacity through the output.
      void putDecision(Node<T> source, Node<T> destination, Node<T> nextHop)
      Adjusts this decision structure so flow between the source and destination at this node arrive at nextHop next.
      Node<T> removeDecision(Node<T> source, Node<T> destination)
      Adjusts this decision structure so that the next node in the supplied flow is undefined.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DecisionStructure

        public DecisionStructure()
        Initializes an empty decision structure.

    • Method Detail

      • getDecision

        public Node<T> getDecision(Node<T> source,
                  Node<T> destination)
        Gets the next node that a message along the given flow should travel.
        Parameters:
        source - The node that created the message.
        destination - The node that the message is destined for.
        Returns:
        Returns the next node that a message along the given flow should travel. This value is guaranteed to be non-null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the next node is undefined.

      • putDecision

        public void putDecision(Node<T> source,
               Node<T> destination,
               Node<T> nextHop)
        Adjusts this decision structure so flow between the source and destination at this node arrive at nextHop next.
        Parameters:
        source - The node that created the message.
        destination - The node that the message is destined for.
        nextHop - The next node that the message should arrive at.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if nextHop is null

      • removeDecision

        public Node<T> removeDecision(Node<T> source,
                     Node<T> destination)
        Adjusts this decision structure so that the next node in the supplied flow is undefined.
        Parameters:
        source - The node that created the message.
        destination - The node that the message is destined for.
        Returns:
        Returns the next node in the flow, or null if it was previously undefined.

      • getDecisionOptions

        public java.util.Set<Tuple<Node<T>,Node<T>>> getDecisionOptions()
        Gets the (source,destination) pairs that map to a hop.
        Returns:
        Returns the (source,destination) pairs that map to a hop.

      • getReservedCapacity

        public int getReservedCapacity(Tuple<Node<T>,Node<T>> voq)
        Gets the amount of capacity reserved across the supplied VOQ.
        Parameters:
        voq - The virtual output queue.
        Returns:
        Returns the amount of capacity reserved across the supplied VOQ.

      • pickRandomInput

        public Node<T> pickRandomInput(Node<T> output,
                      java.util.Random rng)
        Picks a random input, weighted based on the reserved capacity through the output.
        Parameters:
        output - The output.
        rng - The random number generator to use.
        Returns:
        Returns a random input, weighted based on the reserved capacity through the output, or null if no node could be picked.

      • pickRandomInput

        public Node<T> pickRandomInput(Node<T> output)
        Picks a random input, weighted based on the reserved capacity through the output, using the thread's local random number generator.
        Parameters:
        output - The output.
        Returns:
        Returns a random input, weighted based on the reserved capacity through the output, or null if no node could be picked.
        See Also:
        ThreadLocalRandom
